15:54 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi. In the actions (ViewAction for ex), shouldn't we set the "skin" parameter from the URL (if specified) in the context so that xwiki.getSkinFile() can get the correct skin?  
15:55 <vmassol> (could be set in XWikiAction.java so that it works for all actions)  
15:56 <vmassol> could it be this issue: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4124 ?  
15:57 <vmassol> (not quite but close I think)

19:01 <Ruudjah> has joined #xwiki  
19:06 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do you remember where we handle skins actions?  
19:06 <vmassol> "skins"  
19:07 <@sdumitriu> There's no skins action  
19:07 <vmassol> ah need to check web.xml  
19:07 <@sdumitriu> /skin/ is the one that gets through XWiki, and thats SkinAction  
19:07 <@sdumitriu> /skins/ is just filesystem  
19:07 <vmassol> where is the /skins/ rule defined?  
19:08 <@sdumitriu> It's not  
19:08 <vmassol> can't find it in web.xml  
19:08 <vmassol> ok  
19:08 <vmassol> I understand  
19:08 <@sdumitriu> It doesn't go through servlets, it's default filesystem fallback  
19:08 <vmassol> hmmm  
19:08 <@sdumitriu> Like /xwiki/resources/  
19:08 <vmassol> I'm trying to get skin=… in the URL to work  
19:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do you think it's ok to append to the returned url ?skin=… to result returned by getSkinFile when the skin is specified in the URL?  
19:11 <vmassol> my use case is:  
19:12 <vmassol> I have a skin with a custom vm (in a wiki page) which uses getSkinFile to return a js file and that js file itself contains getSkinFile  
19:12 <vmassol> the second call to getSkinFile doesn't use the correct skin though since it has lost the skin=… int he URL  
19:13 <@sdumitriu> I'm not sure, but I guess it should be OK
